Shri Sanjay Khannahas taken over the additional charge of Chairman & Managing Director of BPCL.

Shri Raj Kumar Dubey has taken over the additional charge of Director (Marketing) of BPCL.

Saudi Aramcois reportedly interested in acquiring a 20% stake each in new BPCL and ONGC refineries, as India aims to become a global refining hub.

BPCL's Board approved a Rs. 14,200 crore investment for replacing old refining units and forming a joint venture with Tikitar and Shell India to produce value-added bitumen, pending approvals.

BPCL shares experienced a slight dip of 1.27% after reporting mixed Q1 2025 results, with revenue exceeding expectations but EPS falling short.

BPCL continues its expansion in the e-mobility and biofuel sectors, aiming for 7,000 EV charging stations and 20% ethanol blending by 2025.

BPCL plans to invest significantly in petrochemical diversification at its Mumbai Refinery, including a Kerosene Hydro Treater (KHT) and a Polypropylene Unit (PP).

The company is also developing an integrated 2G + 1G Ethanol Bio-refinery at Bargarh, Odisha.
